thread.title: Six Flags building The Joker roller coaster
thread.title_full: Six Flags building The Joker roller coaster

author:
Linda Zavoral

lzavoral@mercurynews.com
title: Six Flags building The Joker roller coaster
text:
Posted: 09/03/2015 10:48:26 AM PDT Updated: 09/03/2015 01:19:35 PM PDT VALLEJO -- How do you turn the eccentric personality of a comic-book villain into an extreme roller coaster? 
With 3,200 feet of purple and green track, a Zero G barrel roll, three inversions, 15 airtime moments -- and a "step-up, under-flip inverted roll" that will result in riders going horizontal. 
The Joker, he of the maniacal laugh, green hair and purple suit with tails, is coming to Six Flags Discovery Kingdom. 
Two weeks after the park's Roar roller coaster made its final run, Six Flags officials announced Thursday that the traditional ride will be transformed into the park's newest attraction, making it the second DC Comics-themed ride there. The first, Superman Ultimate Flight, made its debut in 2012. 
The coaster's antics are intended to mimic the chaotic personality of this Batman nemesis. Besides the rolls, flips and inversions, park officials promise a first-on-the-West-Coast "breaking-wave turn." 
The construction effort will be an eco-friendly one. The wood-and-steel ride will retain the majority of the wood supports from the Roar, but the layout will differ greatly, a spokeswoman said. 
The Joker should be ready for its first riders in the spring of 2016. Advertisement
